header_summary:
The recent updates in the Bitcoin Core software introduce version v29.1rc2, highlighted by fanquake, which is now available for testing, including binaries and source code accessible through provided links. This version signifies a minor update within the Bitcoin Core suite, encouraging community feedback on any issues via GitHub to enhance the software's reliability before the official release ([Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.1/test.rc2/)).

Jeremy proposes enhancements to Bitcoin's scripting language, focusing on introducing new operations like *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN* and *OP_EC_GENERATOR* to improve script composability and accuracy in elliptic curve operations. These modifications aim to refine the execution process for operations involving the point at infinity and streamline the implementation of *OP_TWEAKADD*, addressing specific shortcomings and inaccuracies in current procedures ([Script Enhancements](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAO3Pvs-Cwj=5vJgBfDqZGtvmoYPMrpKYFAYHRb_EqJ5i0PG0cA@mail.gmail.com/T/#m47aca0b8c4a248d3be1637a936a32fbedd571068)).

Antoine Riard discusses the complexities of achieving consensus changes within the Bitcoin community, advocating for a more inclusive approach to technical discourse. Riard expresses a neutral stance on the CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) proposal, emphasizing the importance of technical merits and potential network impacts over personal enthusiasm. This perspective underscores the need for a comprehensive evaluation and broad engagement in consensus changes to ensure well-informed decisions are made for the Bitcoin network's development ([CTV Discussion](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zr7ZyPi655GsXbsNZMnQpz2RDAwhFqFhkLQ=1JD-1c60A@mail.gmail.com/T/#m7ecfacc5a32280b57264a29564fc8359127fbc4d)).

Bruno's project, bitcoinfuzz, is dedicated to elevating the security of Bitcoin and Lightning Network implementations through differential fuzzing. The initiative has identified numerous bugs across various targets, contributing significantly to the refinement of both protocols. By incorporating a wide range of programming languages and exploring Lightning Network implementations, bitcoinfuzz showcases a comprehensive effort to bolster protocol security through rigorous testing and aims to integrate into Google's OSS-Fuzz for enhanced testing infrastructure ([Bitcoinfuzz Project](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-state-of-bitcoinfuzz/1946)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2 binaries are now available, marking a development step.
- Release notes and source code are accessible online, encouraging community feedback.
- This release aims to enhance Bitcoin Core through collaborative, open-source efforts.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- A new operation, *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN*, aims to counter *OP_EC_POINT_X_COORD*'s effects imprecisely.
- *OP_EC_GENERATOR* is suggested to directly stack the generator point G, improving script composability.
- These additions streamline *OP_TWEAKADD* and clarify elliptic curve operation procedures in Bitcoin's scripting.

recent_posts.title: Workshops and Activation for CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the complexity of consensus changes in the Bitcoin community.
- It mentions a neutral stance on the CheckTemplateVerify proposal by Antoine Riard.
- Riard expresses interest in staying informed through meeting transcripts due to scheduling conflicts.

recent_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
recent_posts.summary:
- An independent "Hayek" unit is crucial for perfect capital markets, meriting further study.
- Bitcoin challenges inconsistencies in academic evaluation of digital vs. traditional assets.
- Academics should equally apply evaluative standards to all assets, including digital currencies.

recent_posts.title: The state of bitcoinfuzz
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoinfuzz aims to enhance Bitcoin and Lightning Network security through differential fuzzing.
- The project has broad integration support, spanning multiple programming languages and has identified over 35 bugs.
- Future goals include OSS-Fuzz integration, expanding fuzzing engines, and targeting Lightning Network improvements.

recent_posts.title: Taking a second look at OP_EXPIRE
recent_posts.summary:
- Miner Extractable Value poses risk of unprocessed transactions, possibly affecting Bitcoin's stability.
- Selfish mining strategy in Monero differs from Bitcoin due to economic and technical contrasts.
- Proposals suggest handling transaction expirations in Bitcoin without altering consensus mechanism.

active_posts.title: Workshops and Activation for CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- A request for feedback on Bitcoin soft fork proposals was made via IRC by 5 March 2025.
- Developers debate technical aspects of proposals, indicating diverse opinions within the community.
- Efforts to facilitate open discussion and collaborative decision-making in Bitcoin's development are highlighted.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
- A proposal enhances Bitcoin scripting with Elliptic Curve operation op codes and Taproot.
- It introduces `OP_EC_POINT_ADD`, `OP_EC_POINT_MUL`, `OP_EC_POINT_NEGATE`, `OP_EC_POINT_X_COORD` for diverse uses.
- Access to the full Bitcoin Improvement Proposal and `btcd` implementation is provided online.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate 2 available
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc2's latest binaries are now available, advancing its software development.
- Users can test the new features through links to binaries and source code on GitHub.
- This release invites community testing, significant for identifying issues before the final launch.

active_posts.title: Writing Simplicity Programs with SimplicityHL
active_posts.summary:
- Simplicity is designed for blockchain contracts, offering minimal design yet hard to master.
- SimplicityHL, a higher-level language complementing Simplicity, eases development on Elements and Liquid platforms.
- It enables non-interactive fee bumping in contracts, improving Bitcoin transactions without external input.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin and Quantum Computing
active_posts.summary:
- A collaborative report on quantum computing's impact on Bitcoin has been published.
- The document suggests strategies for Bitcoin to resist quantum computing threats.
- It emphasizes proactive measures to secure Bitcoin's future against such advancements.

active_posts.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
active_posts.summary:
- The "confidential-script-lib" library allows confidential execution of advanced Bitcoin scripts.
- It uses Trusted Execution Environments and AWS's KMS for high security and minimal trust.
- A key aspect includes a two-step emulation and signing process for script execution.

today_in_history_posts.title: New transaction policies (nVersion=3) for contracting protocols
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin developers propose improvements to v3 transactions, including limiting OP_TRUE outputs.
- Gloria Zhao suggests mempool policies for better Layer 2 support, emphasizing anti-pinning measures.
- Proposed changes to RBF policy aim to alter transaction replacement and mining incentives.

today_in_history_posts.title: Fee Ratecards (your gateway to negativity)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network introduces ratecards for flexible channel capacity rates, allowing negative fees.
- Ratecards adjust liquidity rates automatically, tied to channel capacity, reducing bandwidth for node operators.
- Additional presentation topics include Bitcoin's history, privacy, security, and the importance of decentralization.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims for 1 billion weekly users via 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks." - Main chain's high transaction costs lead to reliance on semi-trusted off-chain services.
- Development focuses on improving scalability while preserving Bitcoin's core values and security.
